message.entry: Encountered an unexpected error during XML processing.
Field does not exist

Unable to open the XML file:

 "{0}"

Check that the file exists and has the correct permissions.
Unable to read XML file "{0}". Permission denied.
Invalid XML file: {0}.
The text "{0} ..." does not contain valid XML data.
No element node with the name "{0}" could be found in the file "{1}". "{2}" must refer to a valid element node name.
"{0}" is an attribute name. "{1}" must refer to a valid element node name.
"{0}" is not an element node. "{1}" must refer to a valid element node name.
Unable to write XML file "{0}". Permission denied.
Unable to write XML file "{0}". Out of disk space.

Unable to write the XML file:

 "{0}"

Check that the directory exists and has the correct permissions.
Unable to write XML file "{0}". Unrecognized URL scheme.
Unable to write XML file "{0}".\nEncountered unknown error with underlying IO stream: {1}
The "{0}" value "{1}" contains the character "{2}", which is invalid as part of an XML element or attribute name.
The first character of the specified "{1}" value, "{0}", is an invalid starting character for an XML element or attribute name.
"{0}" begins with "xml".\n\nAccording to the XML 1.0 specification, element and attribute names that begin with "xml" are reserved for standardization.
Incorrect argument order. "{0}" expects a {1} as its first argument and a filename as its second argument.
"{0}" must be specified as a non-empty string scalar or character vector.
Internal: expected type "{0}" not supported for validateRequiredArgumentOrder.
Internal Error: {0}
Filename "{0}" contains an invalid URL scheme.
Converting strings with length greater than or equal to intmax('int32') is not supported for XML files.
{0} does not support reading XML files. Consider using readtable, readtimetable, or readstruct instead.
